author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Congratulations on your package! Would you consider a more suitable package name? There are many "exact solutions" in science, so that name by itself is almost completely non-descriptive. At the very least, `ExactFieldSolutions` or `Exact2DFieldSolutions`, but there might be a better name that really captures the scope of the package.

Thanks a lot for the suggestion! I think renaming to `ExactFieldSolutions` is a very good idea, hence I applied this change. Some solutions are 3D and some might be 1D, so I would like not to reflect dimensionality in the package name. So far most solutions are for Poisson and mechanical problems but other physics are more than welcome. I will now try to re-register, thanks again! Should I close this PR and start a new one with the new name?
Registration with a new name will open a new PR, which is fine. You can't close this one yourself but someone will do it for you.

body:
- Registering package: ExactSolutions
- Repository: https://github.com/tduretz/ExactSolutions.jl
- Created by: @tduretz
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: d68bb1b987c1334b932e3121128b80a2511eda37
- Git reference: HEAD
- Description: Full field solutions of Poisson and Stokes problems in 2D and 3D. Full field solutions to other problems are welcome!
title: New package: ExactSolutions v0.1.0
